Requirements.Description: SP SLA is an agreement between SDP and service provider which should be enforced before the application SLA during provisioning.
Each of the SP SLAs contain general information on SP and information per NCS.
SLA defined at SP level shall serve as the limit for application SLA. i.e. application SLA cannot be defined above SP SLA level restrictions.
The SP provisioning UI shall allow users to perform the following actions, based on the access rights assigned: Register new SP, View/Edit SP profile, Search SPs.
Operations users with the user role MANAGE_OPERATIONS_LEVEL_SLA_PARAMETERS shall have the authority to create a SP.
Upon clicking on the 'Provisioning' tab available in the header, SDP admin shall be directed to the Provisioning module home page as follows.

Users with the ROLE_CREATE_SP permission shall be able to register a new SP by providing the required information upon: (1) Selecting the SERVICE PROVIDER tab and clicking on the 'Register' link. (2) Clicking on the 'Register' link under 'Service Provider' which appears in the Home page of the Provisioning Module.
When SP accounts get Terminated, Suspended or Removed, the alias associated with the SP account shall no longer be tied to that account.
Upon entering the necessary details and clicking on the Submit button, a confirmation screen will appear with the entered details.

If multiple phone numbers are included for the 'Black Listed Users' field or the character count of the phone number or expression entered is greater than 30, upon submitting the entered information, a link to view the respective information shall appear.
Upon cancelling the confirmation page, the entered information shall be disregarded and the user shall be directed to the Provisioning module initial page.
Once the user verifies the entered details and clicks upon the Confirm button, the SP profile shall be created.

If the profile is successfully created, display success message prompting user to configure SLA for each specified resource: 'Service Provider Profile created successfully. Please configure the Service Level Agreement (SLA) for each resource.'
It is mandatory to configure NCS SLA parameters in order to complete SP provisioning.
If the user clicks Submit without configuring any SLA for each resource, display error: '{List of NCS resources for which SLA has not been configured} SLA should be configured'.
For NCS (SMS/ MMS/ BAS/ WAPPUSH/ USSD/ SWS) selected when configuring the general attributes, the relevant parameters should be configured for each NCS by clicking upon the respective link.
Configured SLA of the selected resources are shown in a different colour and the SDP Admin can edit them by clicking on each link.

Once SLA parameters are configured for each selected resource under the respective SP, the SP profile will be created in SDP and a success message 'Service Provider registered successfully' shall be displayed.
A configuration email shall be sent from SDP-Admin to SP and Marketing users with the SP details using the template specified.

Error_Responses: Please enter 8 digit number for Service Provider Id.

Validation_Rules: Cannot enter a company name which already exists
Error_Responses: Company Name should be less than 50 characters
Address should be less than 255 characters
Description should be less than 255 characters

Validation_Rules: Each MSISDN must be 8 to 15 digits
No duplicate MSISDNs in the list
Cannot include a White-listed MSISDN that exists in Black Listed Users
Error_Responses: Description should be less than 255 characters
You can not have a White-listed user in the Blacklisted user list.
Msisdn are Duplicate in White listed Msisdn.

Validation_Rules: Each MSISDN must be 8 to 15 digits

Fields.Type: String (supports multiple entries and regular expressions)
Validation_Rules: Dedicated alias already in use by another SP at same time is not allowed
Will support regular expressions (case sensitive) and valid alphanumeric patterns
Error_Responses: Dedicated alias/es - [Alias Name] or a wildcard format is already in use
Invalid regular expression/s {Dedicated alias} please enter valid regular expression.
Fields.Related_Document_Reference: Appendix A Section 3.4 Dedicated Alias Regex Pattern Guide

Fields.Type: Multi-select (SP-typed users list obtained from SpUsersGroup)
Validation_Rules: At least one SP-typed user should be selected
Use Shift or Ctrl to select multiple
At least one marketing user should be selected
Use Shift or Ctrl to select multiple
At least one resource must be selected
Use Shift or Ctrl to select more than one

Steps: User clicks 'Provisioning' tab in header
System directs user to Provisioning module home page
User selects 'SERVICE PROVIDER' tab and clicks 'Register' OR clicks 'Register' link under 'Service Provider' on home page
System displays 'Register Service Provider' form
User fills required fields (Service Provider ID, Company name, etc.)
User clicks 'Submit'
System displays confirmation screen with submitted details
User cancels or confirms: if cancel -> discard and redirect to Provisioning home page; if confirm -> create SP profile
On successful creation, display success message and prompt to configure SLA for each resource
User configures SLA per selected NCS resources (SMS/MMS/BAS/WAPPUSH/USSD/SWS) via respective links

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the SMS link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the SMS SLA parameters as specified (refer Section 4.2 SMS SLA).
After submitting the SLA configurations for SMS, display success message: 'SMS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Fields.Field_Name: SMS MO Maximum Messages Per Second
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 1000
If not entered or negative => error
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 1000 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: SMS MO Maximum Messages Per Day
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 50,000,000
If Maximum Messages Per Second greater than this value -> error
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.
Max message per day should be greater than message per Second.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Fields.Field_Name: SMS MT Maximum Recipients Per Second
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 1000
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 1000 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: SMS MT Maximum Recipients Per Day
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 50,000,000
If Maximum Messages Per Second greater than this value -> error
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.
Max message per day should be greater than message per Second.

Steps: Operations user clicks SMS link under Resources
System displays SMS SLA configuration fields
User enters values for MO and MT (per second/day) and optional NCS description
User submits the SMS SLA configuration
System validates values (ranges and numeric)
On success, system displays 'SMS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the MMS link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the MMS SLA parameters as specified (refer Section 4.3 MMS SLA).
After submitting the SLA configurations for MMS, display success message: 'MMS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Fields.Field_Name: MMS MO Maximum Messages Per Second
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 100 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: MMS MO Maximum Messages Per Day
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 50,000,000
If Maximum Messages Per Second greater than this value -> error
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.
Maximum messages per day should be greater than maximum messages per second.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Fields.Field_Name: MMS MT Maximum Recipients Per Second
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 100 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: MMS MT Maximum Recipients Per Day
Validation_Rules: Must be less than or equal to 50,000,000
If Maximum Messages Per Second greater than this value -> error
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.
Max message per day should be greater than message per Second.

Steps: Operations user clicks MMS link under Resources
System displays MMS SLA configuration fields
User enters values and submits
System validates ranges and numeric input
On success, system displays 'MMS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the USSD link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the USSD SLA parameters as specified (refer Section 4.6 USSD SLA).
After submitting the SLA configurations for USSD, display success message: 'USSD SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Fields.Field_Name: USSD MO Maximum Messages Per Second
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 1000 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: USSD MO Maximum Messages Per Day
Validation_Rules: If per second value > per day value -> error
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.
Max message per day should be greater than message per Second.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Fields.Field_Name: USSD MT Maximum Recipients Per Second
Error_Responses: Max message per Second should not be greater than 1000 message per second.

Fields.Field_Name: USSD MT Maximum Recipients Per Day
Error_Responses: Max message per day should not be greater than 50000000 message per day.

Steps: Operations user clicks USSD link under Resources
System displays USSD SLA configuration fields
User enters values and submits
System validates inputs and displays success message on success

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the WAPPUSH link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the WAPPUSH SLA parameters as specified (refer Section 4.5 WAPPUSH SLA).
After submitting the SLA configurations for WAP-PUSH, display success message: 'WAP-PUSH SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Error_Responses: Max recipients per second should not be greater than 100 recipients per second.

Validation_Rules: If per second > per day -> error
Error_Responses: Max recipients per day should not be greater than 500000000 recipients per day.
Max recipients per day should be greater than Max recipients per second.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Steps: Operations user clicks WAPPUSH link under Resources
System displays WAPPUSH SLA configuration fields
User enters values and submits
System validates and displays 'WAP-PUSH SLA for Service Provider configured successfully' on success

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the BAS link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the BAS SLA parameters as specified (refer Section 4.4 BAS SLA).
After submitting the SLA configurations for BAS, display success message: 'BAS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Fields.Field_Name: BAS Maximum Incoming Requests Per Second
Error_Responses: Maximum BAS Incoming Requests per second required.
Max billing per second should not be greater than 100 billing per second.

Fields.Field_Name: BAS Maximum Incoming Requests Per Day
Validation_Rules: If per second > per day -> error
Error_Responses: Maximum BAS Incoming Requests per day required.
Max billing per day should not be greater than 50000000 billing per day.
Maximum BAS Incoming Requests per day should be greater than maximum requests per second.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Steps: Operations user clicks BAS link under Resources
System displays BAS SLA configuration fields
User enters values and submits
System validates and displays 'BAS SLA for Service Provider configured successfully' on success

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking on the SWS link available under Resources, operations user shall be able to define the SWS SLA parameters as specified.
After submitting the SLA configurations for SWS, display success message: 'SWS for Service Provider configured successfully'.

Fields.Field_Name: SWS Maximum Incoming Requests Per Second
Error_Responses: Maximum SWS Incoming Requests per second required.
Maximum SWS per second should be less than 1,000.

Fields.Field_Name: SWS Maximum Incoming Requests Per Day
Validation_Rules: If per second > per day -> error
Error_Responses: Maximum SWS Incoming Requests per day required.
Maximum SWS per second should be less than 50,000,000.

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters

Steps: Operations user clicks SWS link under Resources
System displays SWS SLA configuration fields
User enters values and submits
System validates and displays 'SWS for Service Provider configured successfully' on success

Requirements.Description: Users with the ROLE_SEARCH_SP permission shall be able to search for the existing SP by providing the Service Provider Company Name upon selecting Service Provider tab and clicking on 'Search' link or clicking 'Search' under Service Provider on home page.
Upon entering the SP company name and clicking Search, operations-user shall view search results with information (No, Service Provider ID, Company name, Enabled, Change Status).
Upon clicking on the Service Provider Id, admin user shall be able to view SP information. All information except the Service Provider Id shall remain editable for the admin.
Upon clicking on each NCS link, the existing values for each SLA parameter shall be displayed.
Upon saving, operations-user shall be able to change any SLA parameters by clicking respective link under Resources section.

Fields.Field_Name: Search Bar: Service Provider Company Name

Details: Service Provider ID (entered during SP registration)

Steps: User navigates to Provisioning module home page
User selects Service Provider -> Search
User enters company name into search bar and clicks Search
System displays matching Service Providers in table with columns No, Service Provider ID, Company name, Enabled, Change Status
User can click on Service Provider ID to view/edit SP details and SLAs
User can click on NCS links to view/edit SLA parameters

Requirements.Description: Users with the ROLE_VIEW_DASHBOARD permission shall be able to view a dashboard displaying relevant information for a specific service provider by searching using the service provider company name.

Display SP dashboard information including Service Provider Description, Service Provider (display format '{Service Provider} {Service Provider Id}'), Enabled status, Application ID (auto-generated), Application Name, SMS shortcode, MMS shortcode, State of application.
User should be able to download the information as a CSV with the specified fields.
Service Providers shall be displayed as clickable links; clicking opens related SP information.
Go Back button should redirect user to previous screen.
Applications under each Service Provider shall be displayed as clickable links; clicking opens related application information.
Go Back button from application view should redirect user to previous screen.

Steps: User navigates to SP Dashboard
User searches SP by company name
System displays SP dashboard with SP and application details
User may download full SP/application details as CSV (columns specified)

Requirements.Description: Upon clicking 'Disable' in the Change Status column, the system shall provide the ability to disable the SP profile status.
After disabling the SP profile successfully, display a success message and update Change Status column to 'Enable' for the respective disabled SP profile.
Change of the Service Provider's status will be notified by an email sent from SP-Admin to SP-User and other configured users. Status can be either 'Active' or 'Blocked'.

UI_Elements.Label: Disable link/button in Change Status column

Steps: User clicks 'Disable' for a Service Provider in search results
System disables the SP profile and updates status
System displays success message and updates Change Status link to 'Enable'
System sends notification email to configured recipients with previous and new status

Requirements.Description: User shall be able to Enable the SP profile again upon clicking on 'Enable' in the Change Status column for the respective disabled SP profile.
After enabling the SP profile successfully, display a success message and update Change Status column to 'Disable' for the respective enabled SP profile.

UI_Elements.Label: Enable link/button in Change Status column

Steps: User clicks 'Enable' for a disabled Service Provider in search results
System enables the SP profile and updates status
System displays success message and updates Change Status link to 'Disable'

Requirements.Description: When a SP-user logs in to the Provisioning module, the home page shall be displayed for SP Users.
Upon clicking the 'Profile' link under Service Provider on the homepage, the SP user shall be able to view the list of SPs to which they have been assigned by the admin.
SP user shall be able to edit the Address and the Description of the SP profile by clicking on the Service Provider Id.
Clicking on 'Go back' button shall redirect the user back to the list of SP profiles assigned to the logged in SP user.
Upon user confirmation of updates, display success message: 'Service Provider updated successfully.'

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters
Error_Responses: Address should be less than 255 characters

Validation_Rules: If provided, length must be less than 255 characters
Error_Responses: Description should be less than 255 characters

UI_Elements.Label: Profile link under Service Provider (SP user view)

Steps: SP user logs in and is shown Provisioning Module home page for SP Users
SP user clicks 'Profile' under Service Provider
System shows list of SPs assigned to the user
User clicks on Service Provider Id to view profile
User edits Address and/or Description fields and clicks Confirm/Save
System updates profile and displays 'Service Provider updated successfully.'
User can click 'Go back' to return to SP list

Entries.Description: To identify a ServiceProvider uniquely. This is required for the cdr creation.
This is the unique company name for a ServiceProvider.
This address of the ServiceProvider.
A small description about the ServiceProvider.
Status can have 'Active' or 'Blocked'. Admin can set the status to control a particular service provider.
UI Service Provider type user's list of reference to be assigned for a ServiceProvider.
List of marketing users who can monitor this particular service provider and their applications.
Unique value required for the cdr creation.
Current state of the application: Initial-state/Testbed-state/Limited-Production/Production/Suspended/Retired
Description about the application.
Specify whether manager has approved the application for production.
Timestamp when application reached the creation state.
Timestamp when application reached the testbed state.
Timestamp value for limited production.
Timestamp when application reached suspended state.
Timestamp when application reached retired state.
Timestamp when application reached production.
Reference to the Parent ServiceProvider's id.
Reference to the TestBed type SLA Object.
Reference to the Production type SLA Object.
Where the Application is hosted. Possible values: 'In M1', 'External in Singapore', 'External in Overseas'. Used for Email-notification.
Branding Type of the Application: 'M1 Branded' or 'Corporate Customer'. Used for Email-notification.
Specifies how the Application is going to connect to our system: 'Leased Line', 'VPN', 'Internet'. Used for Email-notification.
Unique username required to log into GUI system.
Password required to log into GUI system.
Contact number of the user.
Email address of the user.
User Group's id which the user belongs to.
User can be in Active or Blocked state.

Section_Name: Appendix D  Short Code and Keywords

Requirements.Description: Short codes shall be used to route a request to the correct application.
Two types of short codes can be defined: Shared short code (more than one application can have same short code; keyword used to route) and Exclusive short code (unique to one application).
A short code can be defined per NCS.
The short code should be a regular expression. (Refer Appendix A Section 3.4 Dedicated Alias Regex Pattern Guide).

When requesting a new short code, the short code must not be accepted if the new short code is a subset of previously defined set of short codes or a previously defined short code is a subset of the new one.
The short code assigned to an application shall be used in both production and testbed environments.
The system should not allow the same keyword assigned to multiple applications under the same short code.

Validation_Rules: No subset conflicts with existing short codes

Requirements.Description: SDP shall allow configuration of a maximum of 50 keywords per short code.
Duplicate keywords shall not be allowed for the same short code.
For shared short codes, routing of an incoming request to the correct application shall be based on the [short code + keyword] pair.
For each keyword, it shall be possible to specify the charging amount.
